brief_summary.textblock:
Primary hypothesis:

      A large reduction in weight is not associated with a change in accurately measured
      glomerular filtration rate (GFR) (51Chromium ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid plasma
      clearance (51Cr-EDTA)).

      Secondary hypothesis:

      A large reduction in weight is associated with a greater change in estimated GFR (The
      Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD-formula)) than in accurately measured GFR.

      Other formulas for estimated GFR (Cockcroft Gault, Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology
      Collaboration (CKD-EPI), CKD-EPI with cystatin C) are better correlated with accurately
      measured GFR.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Bariatric Surgery on Kidney Function
clinical_study.condition: Obese Subjects Who Will Undergo Gastric By-pass Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male or female, older than 18 years of age

          -  Appointed to gastric by-pass surgery on Hvidovre Hospital, Denmark

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Withdrawal of surgical indication

          -  Severe oedema or ascites

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months and 18 months after surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in estimated GFR (as measured by the MDRD formula, the Cockcroft Gault formula, CKD-EPI formula and CKD-EPI with cystatin C formula).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months and 18 months after surgery
Up to 6 months and 18 months after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in arterial stiffness (as measured by sphygmocor)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months and 18 months after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body composition, as measured by Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry scan (DXA-scan)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months and 18 months after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in accurately measured GFR compared with change in estimated GFR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months and 18 months after surgery

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
